EXTRACTED VALUE: If you're after a basketball game for the Santa stocking though, NBA 2K7 is by far the best choice this year.
Lost Odyssey isn't an RPG classic. It doesn't break new ground and it has its problems, but that doesn't keep it from being great.
By far the best, most revined version of FIFA yet - its presentation and 'big game feel' are second to none. [Dec 2007, p.78]
A few rough spots, but the "ultimate" in the game's name is no exaggeration.
Some questionable story elements aside, the game is enjoyable and manages to maintain a fairly consistent pace throughout.
This year's PES is a step backward, and letting players fake injury to draw fouls is the least of the offenses. [June 2008, p.81]
Pure is the new kid on the block, and if given a sequel or two to improve, it could grow into a brilliant beast of a man.
Don't worry about hesitating to spend the $60, you will spend more time than you think playing this game.
A real victory for blue skies in games and the very welcome return of a great franchise.
The first truly "next-gen" Tony Hawk game looks and plays great.
New shooting controls make this version stand out. [Issue #15]
A bit pricey for a game so close to "Bejeweled," but the RPG element genuinely adds to the package. [Christmas 2007, p.98]
Anyone with an appreciation for old school arcade games will have a blast with The Club. Just remember to leave your brain with the doorman.
Cloning Clyde delivers 35 levels of interesting, puzzle-based side-scrolling at a nice price.
